questiontext.text:
Exercise

Evaluate the following double integral, which requires integration by substitution.

\(\displaystyle I=\displaystyle \int_{0}^{@aa@} \displaystyle \int_{0}^{@bb@}5z^{2}w\left( w^{2}-1\right) ^{4}\, \mathrm{d}w \mathrm{d}z\)

\(I=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

If your answer is not an integer, leave it in rational form e.g. 23/5.

generalfeedback.text:
The integration takes place over the rectangle shown below.

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-1, {#wmax#}, {#zmax#}, -1], keepaspectratio: true, axis: true, showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false, grid: false }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on x-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.x.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, // hide numbers majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'z', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [1, -10] } }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on y-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.y.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'w', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [-15, 0] } }); // points var bl = board.create('point', [0,0], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var br = board.create('point', [{#aa#},0], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}) var tr = board.create('point', [{#aa#},{#bb#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var tl = board.create('point', [0,{#bb#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var rectangle = board.create('polygon', [bl, br, tr, tl],{name:"Rectangle",withLabel:false, color: 'white'}); // Set all edges (borders) to dark blue rectangle.borders.forEach(line => { line.setAttribute({strokeColor: 'darkblue'}); }); // Label coordinates dynamically [bl, br, tr, tl].forEach((pt) => { board.create('text', [ () => pt.X() + 0.1, () => pt.Y() + 0.1, () => `(${pt.X()}, ${pt.Y()})` ], { fontSize: 12, fixed: true, highlight: false }); }); [[/jsxgraph]]

We have

\(\qquad \displaystyle I=\displaystyle \int_{0}^{@aa@} \displaystyle \int_{0}^{@bb@}5z^{2}w\left( w^{2}-1\right) ^{4}\, \mathrm{d}w \mathrm{d}z\)

Notice that, since \(5z^2\) is a constant under \(\mathrm{d}w\), it can be factored out of the integrand, and we can then rewrite the double integral as

\(\qquad \displaystyle I=\displaystyle \int_{0}^{@aa@} 5z^{2} \displaystyle \int_{0}^{@bb@}w\left( w^{2}-1\right) ^{4}\, \mathrm{d}w \mathrm{d}z.\)

(This change is covered in more detail in the next section; the question may also be done without factoring out \(5z^2\) from the integrand.)

We can now consider the inner integral,

\(\qquad \displaystyle \int_{0}^{@bb@}w\left( w^{2}-1\right) ^{4}\, \mathrm{d}w \)

which can be evaluated by means of the substitution \(u = w^2 - 1.\)

If \(u = w^2 -1\), then \(\frac{\mathrm{d}u}{\mathrm{d}w} = 2u\), and \(\mathrm{d}w = \frac{1}{2u}\mathrm{d}u.\)

And for the limits, if \(w=0\) then \(u=-1\), and if \(w={@bb@}\) then \(u={@cc@}.\)

So the inner integral becomes

\(\qquad \displaystyle \int_{-1}^{@cc@} \dfrac{u^4}{2} \, \mathrm{d}u\)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = \left[\dfrac{u^5}{10}\right]_{-1}^{@cc@} \)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = \dfrac{{@cc^5@}}{10} - (\dfrac{-1}{10}) \)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = {@dd@} \)

And so the double integral becomes

\(\qquad \displaystyle I = \displaystyle \int_{0}^{@aa@} 5z^{2}{@dd@} \, \mathrm{d}z\)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = \displaystyle \int_{0}^{@aa@} {@5*z^2*dd@} \, \mathrm{d}z\)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = \left[{@5*z^3*dd/3@}\right]_{0}^{@aa@} \)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = {@5*aa^3*dd/3@} - {@5*0^3*dd/3@} \)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = {@(5*(aa)^3*(dd))/3@} \)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

qtest.description: Test case assuming the teacher's input gets full marks.
